name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: Violent crime is down 70% since the 1990s, and cops are safer now than any time in 50 years. 

But training officers often sell a "warrior mentality" drawing on terrifying stories from a world that doesn't exist anymore.

"Training trails experience."

https://t.co/yLZG6cfo0y https://t.co/ZetqeGnryn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gillianbwhite: In this moment of painful and complex reckoning with the realities of ongoing racism a question that kept cropping up was: How did it come to this? To help answer that question, we compiled a century-and-half of @TheAtlantic’s writing about race in America https://t.co/nDc5epCAng

name: TheAtlantic
text: iPads wrapped in plastic bags. Zoom goodbyes. The coronavirus made caring for the sickest patients “an entirely new universe,” @sarahzhang reports. https://t.co/RYGz7vBVf1

name: TheAtlantic
text: America is battling two pandemics: COVID-19 and racism. Join The Atlantic for a live conversation with @adamserwer and @SmithsonianSec about how protests can influence policy and create a more equitable America. https://t.co/KeDJn43xfa

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The news churns, the scandal recedes, and the table is cleared. All the while, the food made by chefs of color, and the stories that journalists of color want to tell, remains on the sidelines.” @ethiopienne on why food media remain so white: https://t.co/AyrT4umltS

name: TheAtlantic
text: Social-media callouts have been criticized as a distraction from on-the-ground activism, but recent weeks have shown that they’re part of the protest, @skornhaber writes: https://t.co/mNbox6yUi4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump vowed to confront a rigged system, to drain the swamp ... Instead, tens of millions of hardworking Americans were swiftly forgotten by the man who vowed to remember them," writes @AdamSerwer: https://t.co/8eqw6SHjmf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Where does democracy die? In workaday courts where long-established judicial precedents are cast aside, in newsrooms where journalists self-censor, and on Facebook, where truth and facts are under siege." Must-read @SheilaCoronel: https://t.co/Boz7vtDgWD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Why have America's instruments of hard and soft power failed so spectacularly in 2020? In part because they are choking on the dust of a dead century," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/TvbV7FsqVD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Bolton has a story to tell. It is very likely a story worth hearing. To absorb it implies no heroism or redemption for the man. It is not an embrace," @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/q7Vnf6oVul

name: TheAtlantic
text: "One conclusion to draw from Monday’s denial to hear those cases is that Chief Justice Roberts may not be so in favor of broadly expanding the scope of the Second Amendment," @adamwinkler writes: https://t.co/GdWCFTMlow

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: "Every four or eight years, the clock hits noon on January 20 and the nation learns whether the old president accepts the legitimacy of the new." https://t.co/XgqzpuVGWW via @PeterAtlantic

name: TheAtlantic
text: Gordon Parks' work for Life magazine "did nothing less than revolutionize what a 'crime photo' could look like," the magazine's former editor-in-chief, @Bill_Shapiro writes. https://t.co/l8c35kY6nF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Understanding the present moment requires grappling with a history stained by racial inequity. We compiled a list of writing on race and racism spanning @TheAtlantic's 163-year history: https://t.co/Wz3t1uXI5u
